page.title: 01DUNVANT,THREE CROSSES,KILLAY
page.content: The area contains the nuclei of three villages,Dunvant,Three Crosses and Upper Killay which grew in the 19th. century due to the development of coal mining and quarrying.These activities have ceased.Today the villages strive to retain their identities against the tide of urban sprawl which threatens to make them suburbs of Swansea. This is especially so in the case of Dunvant where proposed plans to extend residential development bring fears that what rural aspect remains will be lost.New residents have shown a marked interest in the villages retaining their indentities and their enthusiasm has rejuvenated a number of local societies.Welsh used to be the predominant language of the area but, with the influx of English-speaking residents,the native language is now rarely heard.
